lead_paragraph: The aid group said it was leaving six hospitals because the Saudi-led military coalition could not provide assurances they would not be bombed again.

byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana, and Rod Nordland from Cairo. Sheikha Aldosary contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.
byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and ROD NORDLAND

headline.print_headline: Doctors Without Borders Withdraws Staff in Yemen
headline.main: Doctors Without Borders Is Pulling Staff After Hospital Bombings in Yemen

snippet: The aid group said it was leaving six hospitals because the Saudi-led military coalition could not provide assurances they would not be bombed again....
abstract: Doctors Without Borders says it will withdraw staff from Northern Yemen after failure to secure guarantees its facilities will be spared from bombing; claim Saudi-led coalition has struck four hospitals over 17-month period, despite repeated assurances it would refrain from such attacks.
